update gov_legal set title = #{title,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, first_kind_id = #{firstKindId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, second_kind_id = #{secondKindId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, publisher = #{publisher,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, publish_year = #{publishYear,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, code = #{code,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, attachment_id = #{attachmentId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, creater = #{creater,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, update_user = #{updateUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select:
select a.id, a.title, a.first_kind_id, a.second_kind_id, a.publisher, a.publish_year, a.code, a.attachment_id, a.create_time, a.creater, a.update_time, a.update_user,b.type_name as firstKindName,c.type_name as secondKindName, d.name,a.content,e.att_name,e.att_path from gov_legal a left join gov_legal_type b on a.first_kind_id = b.id left join gov_legal_type c on a.second_kind_id = c.id left join mip_organization d on a.publisher = d.id left join mip_attachment e on a.attachment_id = e.att_id where 1=1
and (a.title like concat('%',#{title},'%') or a.publisher like concat('%',#{title},'%') or a.publish_year like concat('%',#{title},'%'))
order by a.update_time desc limit 8

select a.id, a.title, a.first_kind_id, a.second_kind_id, a.publisher, a.publish_year, a.code, a.attachment_id, a.create_time, a.creater, a.update_time, a.update_user,b.type_name as firstKindName,c.type_name as secondKindName, d.name,a.content,e.att_name,e.att_path from gov_legal a left join gov_legal_type b on a.first_kind_id = b.id left join gov_legal_type c on a.second_kind_id = c.id left join mip_organization d on a.publisher = d.id left join mip_attachment e on a.attachment_id = e.att_id where 1=1 and a.id=#{id}
